[$BOX] [$CELL] [$BLOCK]

Atypical antidepressants

Atypical antidepressants are drugs with mechanisms of action that are distinct from other classes of antidepressants such monoamine oxidase inhibitors, selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors, serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors, and tricyclic antidepressants. In this course, the toxicology of representative atypical antidepressants - bupropion, mirtazapine, and nefazadone - will be discussed in separate sections.

[$/BLOCK] [$/CELL] [$/BOX]
Content.Name: Atypical antidepressants
